attachments.title: Denmark suspends use of AstraZeneca COVID vaccine | DW | 11.03.2021
attachments.text: An unconfirmed number of patients have developed blood clots after receiving the shot, according to health authorities. Iceland has also stopped administering the shot.
attachments.fallback: DW.COM: Denmark suspends use of AstraZeneca COVID vaccine | DW | 11.03.2021

text: My girlfriend got the shot four days ago - she had about 1.5 days of high fever, is still feeling off four days later, and has a big swollen red bump at the injection site. Nothing serious, but still... :grimacing:

elements.text: My girlfriend got the shot four days ago - she had about 1.5 days of high fever, is still feeling off four days later, and has a big swollen red bump at the injection site. Nothing serious, but still...

text:
having a high fever and feeling sick after the vaccine is a good sign (as I am sure you know).
Those are the immune response.

elements.text:
having a high fever and feeling sick after the vaccine is a good sign (as I am sure you know).

text: Right, so it works. But it's not exactly pleasant

elements.text: Right, so it works. But it's not exactly pleasant

text:
Was that the AZ vaccine?
In 6 days I get my 2nd shot (Pfizer), which I hear can really affect you.

elements.text: In 6 days I get my 2nd shot (Pfizer), which I hear can really affect you.

text: Yeah, that was the AZ vaccine. Anecdotally, the side effects are worse the younger you are. If that is actually true, we will likely see way more side effects as the population getting vaccinated becomes younger and younger

elements.text: Yeah, that was the AZ vaccine. Anecdotally, the side effects are worse the younger you are. If that is actually true, we will likely see way more side effects as the population getting vaccinated becomes younger and younger
